chapter.title: Configuring Your Automatic Network Connection
chapter.para: The Network Auto-Magic (NWAM) process simplifies network configuration tasks by automatically establishing a network connection at system startup. Using this feature, you can modify the currently active network connection and perform other network administration tasks, such as the following:

listitem.para: View status information about your network connection.
Set up an automatic or custom network profile.
Switch to a different wireless network.
Change to a wired network connection.
Create a list of your favorite network connections.
Add, join, or edit a wireless network.

chapter.title: About the Network Status Panel Icon
chapter.para: This icon is shown in the desktop panel's notification area at all times. The icon is the primary method for viewing the status of your network and interacting with automatic network configuration processes. The Network Status panel icon is where informational messages about your network can be found and it's menu enables quick access to essential network functionality.
The icon's appearance, which is described in the following figure, indicates the overall health of your network.
INSERT GRAPHIC OF ICON WITH EMBLEMS (pg. 2 of UI document)

To display a tooltip showing the name of the currently active location and the status of all enabled connections, hover your mouse over the icon. To configure a network location's properties, click the icon to open the dialog.

sect1.title: Connection Names
sect1.para: Connection names use the format, Interface-Type (Link-Name), where:

listitem.para: Interface-Type is “Wired N” for wired network interface cards (NICs) (where N is not shown for the first wired NIC, and N>=1 for subsequent NICs), or “Wireless N” for wireless NICs (where N is either not shown or >=1).
Link-Name is the link's vanity name, for example net0, or the default device name, if the vanity name has not been defined.

sect1.title: Working With the Network Status Panel Icon Context Menu
sect1.para: To display the Network Status panel icon's context menu, right-click the panel icon.

sect1.title: Network Status Notification Messages
sect1.para: When a significant change in your network status occurs, a notification message is displayed. The message is displayed briefly and then disappears.

chapter.title: About the Network Preferences Dialog
chapter.para: The Network Preferences dialog is where you can configure individual network connections and view the current state of each network connection. The window provides access to various views, from which you can switch by using the drop-down list that is located at the top of the window.
You can access the Network Preferences dialog two ways:

listitem.para: By selecting Network Preferences... from the panel icon's context menu.

chapter.para: The Network Preferences dialog contains a Show drop-down list, which comprises Connection Status, Network Profile, and a list of all of the connections that are defined in the current network profile. To switch views, select the view from the drop-down list. The default view is the Connection Status view.
To switch to the view, select the connection name in the drop-down list or double-click the name while in the Connection Status view.

The Connection Status view shows information about each enabled connection in the current profile (NCP), as configured in the view. To display this view, select Connection Status view in the drop-down list of the Network Preferences dialog. Note that this view does not display disabled network connections.

sect1.title: Switching Views in the Network Preferences Dialog
sect1.para: The Connection Properties view enables you to choose how the IP address for a specific network interface is obtained. For wireless interfaces, this view enables you to choose how and when wireless connections are automatically attempted. The network interface is selected from the Show drop-down list at the top of the Network Preferences dialog.
